New Records: Ivan Schranz scored Slovakia's quickest goal at a major tournament.
Key Match Events: Ivan Schranz scored the only goal of the match at six minutes and five seconds.
Romelu Lukaku had two goals disallowed by VAR, one for offside and one for a handball in the buildup.
Slovakia goalkeeper Martin Dúbravka made a crucial save from Romelu Lukaku's point-blank shot.
Koen Casteels made a superb diving save from Lukás Haraslín's volley.
Slovakia defender Dávid Hancko cleared a shot off the line from Johan Bakayoko.
Pre-Game Insights: There had been talk before the game of this being a new Belgium, casting off the Golden Generation tag and filled with young talent.
Post-Match Reflections: Belgium coach Domenico Tedesco said that the missed chances were a shame but that there was no need to panic for his Belgian side.
Tedesco reflected on the team's performance, stating that they created many chances but failed to convert them.
Tedesco expressed confidence in Romelu Lukaku, despite his disallowed goals and missed chances.
Slovakia coach Francesco Calzona commented on the progress of smaller nations in football and their ability to cause problems for more prestigious nations.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Belgium were without their preferred central defensive pairing of Jan Vertonghen and Arthur Theate.
Jérémy Doku played on the right in the first half and Yannick Carrasco as a left-wing back, leading to a lack of balance in the team.
